item.title: Some takeaway from CPSC213 (2017W2)
item.description: CS213 review 1. The most serious symptom of a dangling pointer bug: The memory pointed to by the dangling pointer may be re-allocated for some other use and then the program might use the dangling-pointer to erroneously update the newly allocated thing, thinking itâ€™s updating the old thing. 2. The most serious symptom of a memory leak: The program could eventually exhaust memory and slow itself, and the entire system it runs on.
